fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Fields are not searchable if -1 issue type (legacy all issue types) appears in the custom field config
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field, update its default custom field context so that it is set to issuetype -1 (You will need to have access to tenant database to do that).
 # Create issue with the field value set.
 # Search for the issue with JQL by the field and the value.

h3. Expected Results

Issue returned.
h3. Actual Results

Issue isn't returned.
h3. Workaround

Clean legacy entry in custom field context table, so that there are no entries that point to -1 issue type (legacy All Issue Types).
fields.summary: Fields are not searchable if -1 issue type (legacy all issue types) appears in the custom field config

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue, it's possible to only create a single linked issue type – it's not possible to have multiple linked (E.g: 'related with' and 'blocks') types on issue creation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Try creating an issue on Jira – and add a linked issue on the create screen

h3. Expected Results
 * It should be possible to have multiple issue link types on the create screen – it's currently possible to have different issue link type on the issue view screen

!Screen Shot 2021-05-28 at 16.33.05.png!
h3. Actual Results
 * It's possible to add only a single issue link type on the issue create screen

!Screen Shot 2021-05-28 at 16.34.33.png!
h3. Workaround
 * Add the different issue links on the issue view screen after the issue is created.
fields.summary: Not possible to add multiple linked issue types on Issue Creation
On the new issue view, pasting a code block in plain text does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Assignee icon disappears from parent sub-task on new issue view(same behavior in Next-gen projects).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # Create sub-tasks below this issue
 # Assign the sub-tasks to someone
 # Go to the parent
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
!Screen Shot 2021-05-27 at 5.55.11 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
!Screen Shot 2021-05-27 at 5.52.38 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Assignee icon disappears from parent of sub-task in the new issue view

fields.description: In the issue layot you can hide fields when Empty but if those have a value they are displayed in the context field part (right panel), it would be helpful to have a way that those fields remain in the Description fields part.
fields.summary: Ability to configure Description fields to hide when empty in the issue layout

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, there are no options to trigger an automation when an issue is exported.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to use "Issue exported" as a trigger for automation rules
fields.summary: Use "Issue exported" as trigger for automation

fields.description: As a user I would like to be able to import from Trello and keep the same issue number.
fields.summary: Import issues from Trello with the same number

fields.description: Availability to Drag and Drop Attachments from issues to Desktop/Folders as from the Old Issue View this was possible
fields.summary: Availability to Drag and Drop Attachments from issues to Desktop/Folders

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When deleting a custom field inside a Team-managed project, the Audit Log will show the author as "*JIRA*" instead of the user who performed the action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field inside a Team-managed project
 # Remove it from the screen and delete it
 # Check the Audit Log

h3. Expected Results

The audit log could show the user who performed the deletion, as it does for the Custom field created.
h3. Actual Results

The author shows as "JIRA" for deleted custom fields:

!image-2021-05-27-12-07-00-865.png|width=532,height=125!
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field on Team-managed projects logs the author as 'Jira'
I want to be able to use Nullish coalescing and optional chaining in Jira Expressions.

fields.description:
Problem specification:
 * The organisation level Audit Log does not track when the Site Access > User Invite options are enabled or disabled, being impossible to trace which JIRA admins may have accidentally allowed invites.

Suggested solution:
 * Register at the site's audit log the enable/disable events for User Invite option, and add the User Account responsible for the action.
fields.summary: Register "Invite User Enable/Disable" events in audit log

fields.description:
As a user I need to set an issue property (external system ID) via Jira Cloud API and then be able to find issues with this property via API, too.

Currently, the searchable properties issue could be created just by an Application module descriptor, see  [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/entity-properties/#how-do-i-make-the-properties-of-an-entity-searchable|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/entity-properties/#how-do-i-make-the-properties-of-an-entity-searchable-]
fields.summary: Configure searchable issue properties via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Recently Created Chart gadget results, the period(date) column is not sorted correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Recently Created Chart gadget to a Dashboard
 # Configure the Gadget with the below settings:
 ## Add filter
 ## Select period as Daily
 ## Enter Days to be shown in the graph, ensure the days selected are more than 31
 # Save the settings
 # Maximize the Gadget, sort Period column.

h3. Expected Results

The Date should be sorted according to the day(number), month, and year.

h3. Actual Results

Dates are sorted based on the Day field first(numerically) and then the month(alphabetically) and the date format is not respecting the Look and Feel configuration.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In the Recently Created Chart gadget results, the period(date) column is not sorted correctly

fields.description: It would be great if we could annotate images by adding text, inserting shapes and lines, using brushes, or adding a blur to a certain area, natively in Jira when uploading images to an issue. It's tedious to have to copy a screenshot in an app, annotate, copy back.
fields.summary: Ability to easily annotate images when creating an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating the status of a sub-task from the parent view and adding a comment to the parent in a next-gen project, the current status is not reflected until the screen is refreshed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a parent issue with a subtask in a next-gen project
 # In the parent issue, click on the subtask status and change it - Notice that the status will be properly changed to the new one you selected
 # Then, add a comment in the parent issue

h3. Expected Results

The new status selected should be kept in the issue.
h3. Actual Results

The status will roll back to the one previously the status change until you refresh the page.

Video reproducing the problem:
[https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/crhZY2VhVZh]
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: Updating the status of a next-gen/team managed subtask and adding a comment requires a refresh

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Under project settings > Issue layout, the names of the tabs are truncated when having a big number of tabs added in the project.

Please, change it to display the tab full title as it does in the issue view (JRACLOUD-76039)?
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with several tabs on its view screen
 # Add fields to the tabs
 # Check the Issue layout tab (Under project settings > Issue layout)

h3. Expected Results

The tabs display their full names in the tabs.
h3. Actual Results

The tabs are truncated:
!Screen Shot 2021-05-26 at 18.28.49.png|width=538,height=227!
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: Tab names are truncated on the issue layout menu

fields.description:
Hello!

I would like external links to open in a new tab by default. (Or, enable a setting to turn this on and off).


I've found requests for this feature dating back to 2006:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9380

In fact, throughout the years, it has been requested many times, across iterations of JIRA:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Open-external-links-in-new-tab-or-window/qaq-p/77373]

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5779

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-514

 

I could go on, but you can search for some of them here:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-514?jql=text%20~%20%22open%20link%20in%20new%20tab%22

This can be done by adding an attribute to your html anchor tag component:

[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target]

There is probably something in your front end that makes this harder than simply adding the attribute, but hopefully this is a small lift for a long-requested feature.

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Open External Links in New Tab

fields.description:
Component sort in the Components' field dropdown has missed in the new issue view. In the old view the list was sorted alphabetically and in the new view, it's not.

*Old issue view:*

!Captura de Tela 2021-05-26 às 15.32.27.png|width=211,height=210!

*New issue view:*

!Captura de Tela 2021-05-26 às 15.31.26.png|width=313,height=176!
fields.summary: Sort Components dropdown list alphabetically

fields.description: After spending some time digging into this, it appears that the vote field is not available in the new issue views. Our team would like to add voting to certain issue types, and are unable to do so.
fields.summary: Allow voting in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be great to have a custom field of "Number(read only)" similar to "Text field(read only)".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field type with "Text field(read only)" and use it in your screens.
 # Enter values in numbers like (1 to 100) for this custom field in issues.
 # Try to use JQL in the card layout to display all these issues to be highlighted in a specific colour if it ranges from 1 to 25(example).
 # The JQL would be of below format and you will get an error stating as expected as it is a text field itself - *_"The operator '>' is not supported by the 'JQL(readonly)PCS-39933[Short text]' field."_*
{code:java}
"JQL(readonly)field[Short text]" > 1 AND "JQL(readonly)field[Short text]" <= 25
{code}

 # If you use the number custom field then the same query will return results as expected.

h3. Expected Results
 - It would be good to have a field in read-only mode for numbers so the customer can use them to highlight these issues in their boards.

h3. Actual Results
 - As the number custom field is editable, they cannot use this field and if they try to use an alternative with a Short text type, then it gives an error as it does not support number values.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Number(readonly) customfield in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using statusCategoryChangedDate on a JQL, the search provides false positives, considering previous status changes. This is counter-intuitive, as getting this field, it only shows the last change.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the status category of an issue, and some time later, change it again
 # Use the _statusCategoryChangedDate_ on a JQL search. Use a logic where the last update should not appear, but prior should.

h3. Expected Results

Only results matching the last status change should appear
h3. Actual Results

False positives, considering other status changes will be shown.
h3. Workaround

You can use other fields for consistent, similar results:

{{resolutiondate}} or {{updatedDate}}
fields.summary: JQL searches with statusCategoryChangedDate consider all status changes, not just the last.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user's locale is different from the tenant's default locale then Jira will attempt to translate multiple strings in the system, such as priority and issue type names and descriptions, even if those values have been changed (i.e. different from the default).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a user with a different locale compared to the one that is used in Jira by default. For example, if Jira default locale is set to _*en_US*_ locale, change the language in user's account preferences to _*English (UK)*_.

 # Create a priority called "critical", note that all letters are small
 # Use the API to get the priorities from Jira: https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/priority

h3. Expected Results

The name of priority in API response is the same as it is visible in Jira database and on UI https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
{noformat}
"self":"https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/priority/<priority id>",
"statusColor":"#000000",
"description":"Atlassian test",
"iconUrl":"https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg",
"name":"critical",
"id":"<priority id>" {noformat}
h3. Actual Results

If the user locale is different than Jira default, "critical" priority is fetched by API as:
{noformat}
"self": "https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/priority/<priority id>",
 "statusColor": "#000000",
 "description": "Crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak.",
 "iconUrl": "https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg",
 "name": "Critical",
 "id": "<priority id>"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Set users's locale to match Jira default locale.
fields.summary: Priority and issue type name and description incorrectly provided by API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new clone experience has been rolled out to Jira Cloud.

It will show possible options according to what exists on the issue that you are cloning (e.g. display option to copy sub-tasks if there are sub-tasks, otherwise the option will not appear).

After the issue is cloned, an option to navigate to the new issue will appear on the bottom-left:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-26 at 10.30.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Have the option to navigate to the new issue appear on the top-right, or offer the possiblity to trigger a new page that will take you to the new issue.
fields.summary: Change how the new clone experience displays the newly created issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

API calls to Jira cloud from office Add-ins macros such as VBA macro for excel, errors out as "Unsupported browser" for office version >= 16.0.13929.20296 with Edge WebView2 (Chromium-based) installed as the browser.
h3. Workaround

To use a machine with office version <= 16.0.13901.20462
fields.summary: API call from office Add-in macros errors out "Unsupported Browser"

fields.description: It would be good to be able to set specific fields within Xray tests to read only.
fields.summary: Read only fields within Jira Cloud - Xray tests

fields.description:
It is important to have a notification sent to a the user or the Admins when a user is removed from the watchers list.

Use case:
Let say If we have added anyone from management as a watcher because of certain attention needed from them and someone remove them from the watchers list that might impact the business majorly. For this if i have option to get notified when anyone added/removed from watcher so that a user could take action accordingly.
fields.summary: Notification when removing a watcher

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If one of the following actions happen to a workflow scheme while it's processing another action might cause data loss:
 * Rename.

 * Change description.

 * Add/remove entities.

 * Modify entities.

 * Publish a draft workflow scheme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare a workflow scheme with many entities (10 should be enough)
 # Do one of the actions listed above.
 # Quickly do another action.

h3. Expected Results

Workflow scheme has the same amount of entities if they were not removed from the scheme in the actions above.
h3. Actual Results

Entities might disappear even though they were not removed from the scheme.
h3. Workaround

The bug happens if user makes more than 1 change to a large scheme with many issue types in a short period (within a few seconds). To avoid the bug, wait a bit before making a subsequent change. 10-15 seconds should be more than enough for a scheme with 20 associations.
fields.summary: Modifying workflow scheme simultaneously causes data loss

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Sprint Health Gadget board link does not retrieve "Quick filters" 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Sprint Health Gadget to a Dashboard
 # From the Gadget select the direct link that will take you to the Board

- [^Bug.webm]

h3. Expected Results
The board should get open and show the quick filters
h3. Actual Results
The board opens and the area where the quick filters should show is only a gray line

h3. Workaround

Refresh the browser to make the quick filters show
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget board link does not retrieve "Quick filters"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the 'Open in Microsoft Excel' option after using the issue navigator search the Excel file opened has 'Story Points' saved as a text value causing a warning from Excel

h3. Suggested Solution

Save 'Story Points' as a number in Excel vs text
 
h3. Workaround 

Excel has a 'Convert to Number' option when viewing the warning which you can use
fields.summary: When opening JQL results in Excel Story Points should be saved as integer value instead of text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users without Browse Projects permission getting "Something's gone wrong" error when accessing an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as a user who doesn't have browse project permission on a specific project
# Try accessing a ticket from that project

h3. Expected Results
You'll receive a "You don't have access to this issue" message
 !image-2021-05-25-17-42-32-248.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The "Something's gone wrong" message will be displayed instead
 !image-2021-05-25-17-43-39-229.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Permission related issues are throwing a misleading error message

fields.description:
It would be awesome to see on the _right panel_ only pinned fields, dates and user fields. On the _left panel_ functions like tabs.

On the old issue view we used to have a similar layout:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 13.41.46.png|thumbnail! 

(i) The Automation field could be displayed or re-ordered too.
fields.summary: Improve panels on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There's no page listing all changes performed by user: issues updates, configurations changed...
h3. Suggested Solution
On user profile, add the actions performed on issues and also the settings updates.
fields.summary: Ability to view All changes performed by an user

fields.description:
Hi,

 

It would be of massive benefit and value to be able to "group" by a field/custom field rather than the predefined values offered out of the box within Advance Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Advance Roadmaps - Group by custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the issue view screen, applying the comment security in the issue transition screen hides some fields in the drop-down.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue in the new issue view in a new tab. 
 # Change the issue status from one status(*To Do*) to another (*Selected for development*). 
 # Have a screen configured for issue transition in the workflow from *To Do* to *Selected for development.*
 # The "*Selected for development*" transition screen appears.
 # Select the lock in the comment section and scroll through the drop-down fully to see all the roles and groups.
 # You will find that you are not able to view all the options from the drop-down
 Video of replication - [2021-05-13_12-50-44.mp4^ !https://getsupport.atlassian.com/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif|width=7,height=7! ^|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/6000408/6000408_2021-05-13_12-50-44.mp4]

h3. Expected Results

You must be able to see all the options in the drop-down.
h3. Actual Results

You will not be able to see some of the roles/groups from the drop-down.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In the issue view screen, applying the comment security in the issue transition screen hides some fields in the drop-down.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It it possible to ignore a required resolution field when closing a ticket via transition API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an open ticket with required resolution field
 # Create and execute a post request (transition) that closes the ticket
 # The ticket is closed without resolution set

h3. Expected Results

The ticket cannot be closed due to resolution field not being set.
h3. Actual Results

The ticket can be closed successfully.
h3. Workaround

Adding a field required validator on the workflow transition will make the field required in the API.
fields.summary: Using transition API on an issue with required resolution can close a ticket without setting the resolution.

fields.description:
The Jira cloud macOS and iOS app throw an error when adding an attachment after setting it in the validator.

Steps to reproduce:
 - add a requirement to add an attachment in the validator of transition

 - On iOS it’s impossible to add the attachment in the transition screen, it will show this error:

!image-2021-05-25-11-41-43-551.png!

- We see an error on the Android App as well.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Transitioning issue requiring adding an attachment will fail with an error 400

fields.description: In the business project (Jira Work Management), I would like to have possibility to add custom fields as columns. Now, options are very limited.
fields.summary: Ability to add custom fields to the List

fields.description:
In the old issue view, security level was always present in the issue without users having to click it. Now it is displayed in a padlock icon and requires users to click to see what the level is.

This is important information that should always be present for users. Admin should be able to add this field to the issue where they want it, as they can for labels.
fields.summary: Security level is displaying as a padlock icon in the New issue view

fields.description: When you split a feature, it lists the stories that will move to the new feature. Is it possible to have a checklist so you can select the planned / in progress stories that should move to the new feature?
fields.summary: Enhance split feature to enable selection of stories that will move to the new split

fields.description:
Currently select-list (multiple choices) custom fields have a certain width in the issue screens; however, when an option's character count reaches a certain number the options are displayed truncated and it appears that they only use half of the width of the field.

Please make it so that the options at least use the full width of the field without being truncated and if possible display the full extent of the options at all times.

See the screenshot for reference.
fields.summary: Increase the amount of characters displayed in select-list (multiple choices) fields
Rest API shows Notification Scheme without scope for Next-get projects moved to trash

fields.description:
Description: 
Allow Copy attachments in Cloud
Need to ensure we consider:
restrict file size
Both overall and individual
Timeouts


Environment
None

AUT ticket:
https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1030
fields.summary: Allow Copy attachments in Cloud Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue details dialog doesn't open after page reload in Firefox 87.0. Windows.
h3. Steps to Reproduce


# Go to board page. For example [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=206]
# Ensure the side view is enabled.
# Click some issue to open the side view. sideview with the issue details opens.  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Reload the page. With F5 for example.

h3. Expected Results
Sideview opens.

h3. Actual Results
Sideview is blank for all issues.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Change to a different functionality, and then go back to the backlog.
fields.summary: Issue details dialog doesn't open after page reload in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Find actions dialog appears and disappears if the Issue details dialog is opened.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1:*
1. Open Project components or releases page 
2. Click Create component/release
3. Click any place inside dialog but outside any field to remove focus from input
4. Press "." hotkey opening Find actions dialog

*Scenario 2:*
1. Go to board page. For example [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=183&projectKey=ACJIRA]
2. Click Share icon at the right-top. Share popup appears.
4. Press "." hotkey opening Find actions dialog.



*Dev note:* Seems to be it happens due to react-focus-lock lib used in Atlassian dialogs. When Another dialog appears and teies to "steal" focus the lib returns it by force back. It's handled like click outside second dialog and it immediately closes.
h3. Expected Results

**Action dialog appears.
h3. Actual Results

Action dialog appears and disappears.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Find actions dialog appears and disappears if the Issue details dialog is opened

fields.description: Users would benefit from the ability to perform searches in the audit log of a rule for multiple purposes, specially if their execution count is too high to look through each entry.
fields.summary: Ability to perform searches in the Automation audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating between issues using the issue view list, changes made on issues trought the issue view does not reflect to the issue view list, it is required refresh the issue view list to have the issue updates applied to the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any project
 # Select *Issues > All issues.*
 # Select *Switch to list view*.
 # Select any issue on the list view.
 # Change the issue status.
 # Select *Issues* *> All Issues.*
 # The issue status updated at step 5 has not changed, it is still showing the old status valiue.
 # Refresh the page.
 # The issue status is updated.

[^screen-capture.webm]
h3. Expected Results

Return to the issue list view should automatically reflect changes made on issues.
h3. Actual Results

Return to the issue list view does not reflect changes made on issues.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the issue view list page.
fields.summary: The issue view list does not reflect changes made on the issue view.

fields.description:
A quick search leads to hundreds of cases of problems with branch name case
including one from atlassian where there are problems with mixed case in
branch names:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Case-sensitivity+in+branch+name+causes+issue

Microsoft recommends all lower-case branch names:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/repos/git/case-sensitivity?view=azure-devops#branch-and-tag-names

Some git clients will even convert some parts of branch names to
lower-case, like when using '/' in the name. GitHub Desktop had problems
with this, Visual Studio had problems with this, Jetbrains products had
problems with this, etc.

There are lots of documented problems for GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket and
other providers about mixed case branches and tags.

For all these reasons, most git guides, naming conventions, etc recommend
using all lower-case branch and tag names.
fields.summary: Sync lower-case issues keys that come from GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket and other providers.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the default event fired by the "Fire event" post-function is changed in a workflow transition, any related webhook(s) is not fired.

For example, the initial transition (issue creation), by default fires an *Issue Created* event, saying: "Fire a *Issue Created* event that can be processed by the listeners."

 

!Screen Shot 2021-05-21 at 10.56.41.png! If the post-function is updated to fire something other than the *Issue Created* event (for example, a custom event), then _jira:issue_created_ webhooks will not be sent by Jira when issues are created in projects that use the modified workflow.

This works in a similar way for any other transition and the _jira:issue_updated_ webhooks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the post-function to fire a different event

h3. Expected Results

Any relevant webhook is sent by Jira.
h3. Actual Results

Webhooks are not sent by Jira.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to restore the default event in the workflow post-function:
 * *Create Issue* for the initial transition
 * *Generic Event* for any other transition
fields.summary: Changing the default events fired by workflow post-functions prevents webhooks from being sent

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Issue types association to workflows were missing from Workflow Scheme
h3. Environment

Production
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 30+ projects associated to Workflow Scheme
 # Add a new Workflow association to issue type that didn't exists before

h3. Expected Results

_Workflow Scheme to has all issue types associated to each respective workflow_
h3. Actual Results

_Workflow Scheme missed Issue types association to workflows_
h3. Workaround

_N/A_
h3. Notes
fields.summary: All Workflows associations were missed in Workflow Scheme after new workflow association

fields.description:
Customer has several versions and the quantity is making it troublesome to select the appropriate fix versions from the drop-down menu when creating or editing a task

 

They tried archiving some versions in the [Releases] panel, but they continue appearing in the drop-down:

!image-2021-05-20-13-32-48-305.png!

 

It would be great if archived releases were hidden from that selector.
fields.summary: Hide the archived fixed versions from the dropdown menu in an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When adding custom field images in the card layout using the Board Settings for Scrum or Kanban Board, the images/thumbnails are fetched from the issue attachment. However, there is no pattern in which the images/thumbnails are shown.
 When there are multiple images attached and removed from an issue simultaneously, there is no clear pattern or rule on which image will be selected as the Card Thumbnail.

Would also like to know if there is a priority-based logic behind the Thumbnails on the Card of a board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Go to a Classic Project and create a Scrum or a Kanban Board.
 # Select *...* 3 dots from the top right corner and click on "*Board Settings*".
 # Go to "*Card Layout*".
 # Click Add and then select *images* as the field name
 # Go "*Back to board*".
 # Open an Issue and add multiple attachments randomly using *comments*, *Add attachment* button, and, using the *+* button located above all attachments in the Issue View.
 # Delete few comments(with attachments), Delete attachments from the list in the random selection and there is no predictability with what could be the next image/thumbnail of the Card on the board.

h3. Suggestion:
 # Make the most recent and latest .png or, .jpeg attachment in the list the thumbnail for the Card.
 # Even though users add the images through various mediums like *comments*, *Add attachment* button, and, using the *+* button the latest image attachment in the list (Based on date and time) should be the one shown on the card.
fields.summary: Images/Thumbnails on the Card of a Board retrieved from the Issue attachments are displayed randomly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue Search field is locked on Jira Cloud for Mac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Jira site using Jira Cloud for Mac
 # Try to click on the Issue Search field on the left side to insert a value

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to insert values in the search field

h3. Actual Results
Field is locked

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue Search field is locked on Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When right-clicking on the files & images of attachments section in the new issue view the *Save as...* option doesn't appear.
This option used to appear in the old issue view.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Right click on the file in the attachments section - (on the new issue view);
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 9.53.09 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to *Save as ...* the attachments of the issues by right-clicking.

h3. Workaround
The alternative solution is to open/expand the file before saving, as the example in the short video below:
[^Screen Recording 2021-05-20 at 9.43.07 AM.mov]
*Or*
Save the file by right-clicking on the files in comments or description.
!Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 9.52.11 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Save as..." option in attachments section(new issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira is returning a 500 HTTP error when user tries to add attachment. This was noticed through API usage ([add attachment|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-attachments/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-attachments-post]).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Trying to add attachments through API calls

h3. Expected Results
Attachments should be added with no further issues.

h3. Actual Results
An error occurs and user has to retry.

h3. Workaround
Retry action.
fields.summary: Add attachment action results in HTTP500 error

fields.description: It would be nice to overhaul the list view to be able to have sections and indented levels of subtasks.
fields.summary: List View Alteration

fields.description:
h3. Description

The only information the filter seems to accept is the user ID. if the same contains special characters, like ":" from old IDs, the search doesn't bring any results.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Add Activity Stream to a dashboard
 # Add a filter
 # Select _Username is <userID>_

h3. Workaround

No workaround known at this moment.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Gadget - Username Filter doesn't work with special characters.

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to have a more intuitive way to select the users for this gadget filter. Seems it only supports user ID and has some inherited problems.
fields.summary: Enable User Picker for Username filter on Activity Stream Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Story point cannot be edited via Safari 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access backlog
 # Open an issue
 # Fill out the story point via side view
 # Without reload the page try to edit the storty point

(!) Reproduceble only via Safari.

 * [Video with the steps|https://share.getcloudapp.com/rRuG49WP]

h3. Expected Results
It should be edited without reload

h3. Actual Results
We need to reload the page to be able to edit the story point.

h3. Workaround
We can reload the page after set the story point.
fields.summary: Story point cannot be edited via Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint field not displayed in Subtask if the parent is not added to a Sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Scrum project
 # Do not add the issue to Sprint
 # Create a subtask in the same issue

h3. Results

Sprint field is not displayed in the Subtask
The field will be available when the Parent issue is moved to a Sprint.

h3. Suggestion

Display the sprint field on an issue if it’s on the screen, even when it’s non-editable. Also, add a message similar to the old issue view to notify users that the field can't be edited on the sub-task.
fields.summary: In New Issue View Sprint field is not displayed in Subtask if the parent is not added to a Sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are trying to copy the date to any *one* of the Text area fields such as *Comment* *editor* and *Description* *editor*. The date changes once it is copy-pasted to the text area.

*For Example:* 

When we copy-paste the string "4. 5. 2021 13:52" in any text-area editor , then it changes this string into "1. 5. 2021 13:52" because it thinks, that it is first item of a numbered list. {quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on comment editor or description editor
 # Paste the text "4. 5. 2021 13:52" or any date value using dots.
 # The pasted string would change the first character as a numbered list.

h3. Expected Results

Should be pasting the date as copied from the resource.
h3. Actual Results

It tries to print a number list as shown in the screenshot

h3. Workaround

Using a rich text editor solves the problem but it currently not feasible in the New issue View.
fields.summary: Copy-Pasting date in the editor converts the first character to Numbered list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We have the ability to share an issue with any user via the "Share" option available in the Jira issue view:

!Screenshot 2021-05-19 at 1.35.44 PM.png|width=341,height=215!

However, responding to this email does not add the response as comments to the existing issue. Instead, Jira creates a new ticket as per the incoming handler configuration.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great to have the ability to handle responses to "Share" issue emails as comments to the existing issue.
fields.summary: Ability to handle email responses as comments for the emails sent via "Share issue" option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to edit an issue from the Filter results gadget the page will start loading but will hang in the waiting circle.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the dashboard page add the gadget for "Filter results".
 # In any of the issues in the gadget click the 3 dots and select "Edit".
 # Page will start loading but it will hang.

h3. Expected Results

It should allow you to edit the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Page hangs on the waiting circle.
h3. Workaround

* Directly click on the issue key in the gadget or open the issue in a new tab.
* Alternatively, right-click the Edit link and select "Open in a new tab", then edit the issue in this new tab.
fields.summary: Attempting to Edit Issue from Dashboard "Filter results" gadget hangs Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team Field does not get exported from subtasks when it has value
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Advance search screen
 # Search for subtasks that will contain a value in the Team field and export them
h3. Expected Results
Should show values for the Team field of exported issues
h3. Actual Results
The team field is blank

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Field does not get exported from subtasks when it has value

fields.description: Due to security reasons, and considering the customers that deal with sensitive that in their instance, would be useful if the Jira incoming mail handler has the option to restrict the ticket creation if the from of the email matches certain domain(s).
fields.summary: Option to restrict incoming mail handler by domain

fields.description: Allow parent link from a different Jira site so that parent from across On-Premise Jira could be linked to a child in Jira Cloud. This will allow epics from on-premise solution to show up as Child issues on Initiative in Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Allow parent link across the Jira sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL query when used as below : 

 
{code:java}
labels != xyz {code}
 

Does not return the issue that has no labels in it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JQL query in advanced search as below : 
labels != <labelname> 
 # Search and you will see that the issues that do not have empty values in labels field will not be returned.

h3. Expected Results

expected to return all the issues which does not have labels as xyz (including those who have labels field empty) to be returned.
h3. Actual Results

The issues that has another value in labels field except for the searched value will be returned.
h3. Workaround


workaround is to use labels = null to retrieve the results.
fields.summary: JQL filter with Labels does not display "EMPTY"

fields.description:
h3. Problem

User not able to see the LABELS created on create issue screen.
h3. Environment

Company managed
 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce

create a new issue and create labels on this create issue screen.
 Now try to use them on the existing cases on the project. It comes as a new label
 Create a new case again and try to add these labels when creating this new issue. The labels are available while typing it( clicking it outside gives the label once typed in, without creating it( clicking on the new Label).
h3. Expected Results

Newly created labels should be available
h3. Actual Results

Not available under the dropdown for the customer to select
h3. Workaround
h3. Notes

This puts customers in great difficulty as they believe the labels are not created and they create it again and shows inconsistency.
 The created labels are not available for customers to select
fields.summary: Labels not found on existing cases when created using a create issue screen

fields.description:
At the moment, everyone can create, edit and delete labels.

This is not ideal for growing businesses as it becomes more essential to preserve the integrity of the labels, such that there is tighter administration oversight to the creation of labels so that it does not get misused, in which will then cause the precise choice of labels to become a challenge for the users raising issues in Jira.

Please improve the administration of labels and introduce permissions that control who can create/edit/delete labels.
fields.summary: Improve administration of labels and introduce permission control

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

If we set the security level under team-managed and an addon needs to access the issue, the addon might not load the issue. For these reasons, we need a possibility to add the "*Atlassian-addons-admin*" under Project setting >> Access. 

Or we should be able to add the role "*Atlassian-addons-admin*" [under security level|https://share.getcloudapp.com/P8u5BQ9k].
fields.summary: Ability to add the role "Atlassian-addons-admin" under team-managed security level

fields.description:
At this time, there is no way to add an If/Else block inside another If/Else block

!image-2021-05-17-12-38-41-995.png!
fields.summary: Allow nested If/Else blocks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The _Comment visibility_ option for the *Comment on issue* action is not available when the scope of the rule contains a Business or Software project type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a rule and set the *Scope* to _Single project_ using a Software or Business project
# Add a *Comment on issue* action and expand the *More options* drop-down

 !Automation_rules_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

When expanding the *More options*, you should have additional options to set the _Comment visibility_ of the comment being added.

 !Comment_visibility.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The *More options* is gone with no way of setting the _Comment visibility_.

 !No_options.png|thumbnail! 

This is also applicable with the followings *Scope* settings:
* Multiple projects that contain one or more Software/Business projects
* Project type: Software projects
* Project type: Work management projects

h3. Workaround

Set the *Scope* of the rule to _All projects_ which will make the rule global so that you can gain access to the _Comment visibility_ options. Once configured, you can remove the global scope and set it to any Software or Business project and it will function as expected.
fields.summary: Comment visibility option not available on Software and Business projects

fields.description:
Exporting issues using *Export excel CSV(Current fields)* creates duplicate columns when the same custom field name is used in both Company-managed and team-managed projects.
h3. How to Replicate
 - Have a customfield in the classic project.
 - Use the same name(*Filter-duplication*) and type. For *Eg:* *Text Field (single line)* in classic/Company-managed project and *Short Text* in Next-Gen/Team-managed project.
 - Now create a filter to list issues for the classic project and save it.
 - Select the column section and select this custom field *Filter-duplication* so that it is displayed in the GIN.
 - Now export these issues using *Export excel CSV(Current fields)*.
 - Even though you have selected just one field, it will show up two columns for the same custom field wherein, one custom field will have the values as provided in the Company-managed project however, the other column will be blank with no values.

*Video replication* - [https://www.screencast.com/t/RcVfrzQfU]
h3. Expected result
- Only one column for the custom field(which is present both in Company-managed and team-managed projects) should be visible when we select only that field and use *export current fields*

h3. Actual result
- Even though we select to export only the selected field, still it creates a duplicate column where one column will hold all the values and the duplicated column will be empty with no values.
fields.summary: Exporting issues creates duplicate columns when the same custom field name is used in both Company-managed and team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the *Team* field from Advanced Roadmaps is included in your filter subscription, the avatar icon is oversized taking up much space and this varies on where you're viewing the subscription email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any filter where the results have a value for the *Team* field
 # Subcscribe to the filter and make sure the *Team* field is included in the "filter" column

h3. Expected Results

When you receive the email for the subscription, you will see a list of issues with the included fields.

h3. Actual Results

The team avatar icon under the *Team* colum is oversized.

 !_JIRA__Subscription__Team_is_not_EMPTY.png|thumbnail! 

This only affects the following clients for viewing emails:
* Outlook on web browser
* Outlook app (Windows/macOS)
* Mail app (macOS)

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Oversized avatar icon for Team field in filter subscription

fields.description:
Currently, Jira offers a feature to define the order of options in the Custom field. The options will be displayed in the defined order while selecting the options for the Custom field in an issue.
In the advanced search, by default, the custom field options will be listed in alphanumeric order.

h3. Suggestion

In the advanced search, please include the ability to list the custom field options in the defined order.
fields.summary: Ability to specify the order of Custom field options non alphabetically in Jira Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user orders by JQL results by _parent_ clause all other order by clauses that are added after it are ignored.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run JQL that sorts by parent and some other clause. For example: _ORDER BY parent, assignee_

h3. Expected Results

Issues that have the same parent are sorted by assignee
h3. Actual Results

Issues that have the same parent are sorted by issue key. Ordering by assignee is ignored.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ordering JQL results by parent clause ignores other order by clauses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Commit Created" trigger is suddenly triggering when PR merged.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose commit created trigger
 # Provide subsequent action for the trigger. 
 # You will observe when a PR merged, the commit created trigger will be executed. 

h3. Expected Results

Only when a commit is created, the rule should trigger
h3. Actual Results

Whenever a PR merged, we see that the commit created trigger is executed.

A short demonstration on the behavior here ---> [^devops_trigger.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira : "Commit created" trigger is triggering when PR merged

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the new issue view when an image is attached in a comment or description the default size when added is large and takes up a lot of space, requiring manual scaling down of the image to fit within additional content, requiring additional effort for the end user.

It would be more efficient in a user's workflow to have a smaller image by default then scale up if needed as opposed to the current manual downscaling to achieve the same result.  Once an image is in a comment clicking an image thumbnail to view in the full-screen preview is more efficient than having the image already at a larger scale in a comment field, as a user could manually scale up the image as needed when posting the comment if a larger image is desired

h3. Suggested Solution 

Have the image attachment default size in comment and description fields as a small thumbnail vs full-size images to reduce the size of the footprint, maintain the option to scale up as desired
 
h3. Workaround

Currently, you can only scale the images down to a smaller size while editing the comment
fields.summary: Default image attachment size as thumbnail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Safari web browser, you can't edit any numeric field in the backlog view, It seems to be a problem with the front-end code or CSS style. 
The same behaviour is also observed when editing the time estimate fields like "Original estimate" directly from the issue using the Safari browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the backlog view
 # select any issue and try to edit the Story points or any numeric field in the right panel. 
 # The box component is hidden or disabled [^safari_error.mp4]

h3. Expected Results

You should able to edit the Story points.
h3. Actual Results

The input component gets hidden unable to edit the value.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use another web browser

Open the issue in a new tab.
fields.summary: Editing Story Points in the backlog view doesn't respond

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying a code block using Safari, the line numbers are also copied
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira ticket, add a code snippet/block
 # Copy the code using Safari
 # Paste the code on an editor like Sublime 

h3. Expected Results

When pasting the code, it will be pasted only the text/code
h3. Actual Results

It shows the line numbers (only the number of the first line is not copied) 

!Screen Shot 2021-05-14 at 15.17.45.png!

!Screen Shot 2021-05-14 at 15.17.22.png|width=245,height=374!
h3. Workaround

Use another browser like Chrome or Firefox.
fields.summary: When copying a code block using Safari, the line numbers are also copied

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

Deployments are not currently included in the [+development fields reference+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-development-fields-reference-973491363.html] search functions available in Cloud and not included in the available properties.

* development[deployments].all
* development[deployments].deployed
* development[deployments].environment

When attempting to use any of these search functions you will get the following error:

 !Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|width=900&height=400!

h3. Proposed solution

Add supportability in Cloud for Deployments to allow development related searches referencing deployment status and environment.
fields.summary: Add support for deployments in development fields search functions

fields.description:
Currently in the Cloud version, is only possible to suppress notifications for the *Edit Action*.

As an Admin, I'd like to have the same option for the other actions like *Transition and Assign*.

h3. Notes

- This option was already available in a past Server version:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

- Option available in the *Edit Action*:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to have the ability to choose if a rule should send emails in certain actions

fields.description: The customer would like to have an option for the site-admins to have the ability to control who can create/edit priority fields in the instance so that not all Project admins can create or change priorities in the instance.
fields.summary: Provide an option for site-admin to control who can create Priority field
Convert HTML to Atlassian markup while creating and updating issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Provide the ability to report on project permissions by user across all projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Review permission schemes used by projects
 # Admin would like to understand which users have which permission/s in each project

h3. Expected Results

Ability to report/audit user permissions for each project at a high level.
h3. Actual Results

N/A
{noformat}
 {noformat}
*Workaround*
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to audit project permissions by user

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Short cuts keys 'l' and 'm' not working  in new issue view for* list view.*
These keys were working in the old issue view for list view

h3. Environment
JS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use a filter to load the issues on Jira
Switch to list view
press m or l
Nothing happens


h3. Expected Results
The short cut keys should work

h3. Actual Results
Shortcut keys are not working

h3. Workaround
Use detail view

h3. Notes
Any ETA that can be provided on when this will be fixed as these keys were working on the old issue view?
fields.summary: Short cuts keys l and m not working for the customer in new issue view for list view

fields.description:
Currently, there is no JQL command that allows user to search for issues from previously close sprints, for example: 
 * _As an user, I would like the ability to conduct search for issues that were part of the past 6 sprints for a specific project, so that I may obtain trending information._
 * _As an user, I would like the ability to search for items that was part of a sprint that was completed 15 sprints ago relative to the currently active sprint._

Thank you.
fields.summary: Ability to search for content under a previously completed sprint based on user selection

fields.description:
In the old view, you could click on a .zip file and a dropdown list of the files in the zip file would appear. 

In the new view, you can only download the zip file without the ability to preview the list of files.
fields.summary: New View does not allow exploring zip files within Attachments section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to use Markdown on the editor of the new issue view to add hyperlinks (syntax '[text](URL)') there is some unexpected behavior.

For example, the hyperlink might not render at all or, in some cases, it will render but when you send the comment it will become normal text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # If you add '(' then paste a URL, the URL will be automatically rendered and a blank space will be added after it. If you then try to add ‘)' it will not render the hyperlink since there is a blank space, so you’ll need to first remove the blank space then add ‘)', which will render the hyperlink successfully. However, when you send the comment, the link doesn’t work: [Testing Markdown Hyperlink 1|https://share.getcloudapp.com/DOuDZ622].
 # if you first create the ‘()’ and put the URL inside, it will not render as a hyperlink. If you then proceed to remove the last ')’ and add it again at the end, it will render. The ‘)' needs to be the last character you enter:  [Testing Markdown Hyperlink 2|https://share.getcloudapp.com/12uAYv5G].

h3. Expected Results

The hyperlink should be rendered in all cases.
h3. Actual Results

The hyperlink is not rendered, or, it is rendered on the comment text box but when sent it becomes normal text.
h3. Workaround

Use the *Link* button.
fields.summary: Trying to add a hyperlink with Markdown on the new editor has unexpected behavior

fields.description:
We would like to have an option in the Jira cloud that will show certain fields based on the selected initial select list field.
For example: 
* If field 1 = 'some1'
** I want to show fields number 2 & 4
* If field 1 = 'some2'
** I want to show field numbers 5 & 7 only
And so on....
fields.summary: Display certain fields based on the selected initial select list field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we create options with a trailing whitespace for a custom field option for a Select List custom field , the JQL wont recognise without this trailing space. As the trailing spaces are not stripped while creating the options.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Select List custom field.
 # Add an option called "JiraSoftware ". _Notice the trailing white space at the end here._
 # Perform a JQL search for this field option without the trailing white space.

h3. Expected Results

Ideally the trailing white spaces should have been stripped while adding the option, as it serves no purpose. And then JQL should be able to return if we search for "JiraSoftware" ( without the space)
h3. Actual Results

JQL throws an error that "JiraSoftware" does not exist as an option. Thats because the whitespace is not stripped.
h3. Workaround
 * Stick to the options suggested by the JQL while creating the query. This automatically adds the correct option with the whitespace at the end.
 * Go to the custom field context page and then edit the option to remove the trailing whitespace.
fields.summary: When we add options to Select list custom field with trailing white spaces, JQL does not recognise the option value for this field

fields.description: Suggestion: Allow Jira Administrators to filter the Project list on instance by its type (Company-managed / Team-managed)
fields.summary: Allow Project list to be filtered by Type (Company-managed, Team-managed)

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

In its current state, the *Request Participants* amongst other Jira Service Management specific fields are restricted to Service Management projects and cannot be used in other project types such as Business and Software.

When attempting to use the field in a non Service Management project you will get the following error:
{code}
Search failed. Try reloading the issue.
{code}

h3. Proposed solution

Allow this field to be also be used in Business and Software projects or at least not allow this field to be added to screens associated with Business or Software project types.
fields.summary: Allow the Request Participants field to be used in other project types

fields.description: When viewing the Issues section of the Jira Mobile app, currently, the Summary, Ref, and status are displayed. This request is to ask for configuration options so the fields that are shown can be changed.
fields.summary: Allow customizing fields shown in Issues section of the Mobile app

fields.description:
The comment box position should not change its position according to the comment sort setting.
The comment box should be fixed at the bottom irrespective of the order of the comments like it was in the old issue view.
fields.summary: Fix the comment box position to the bottom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we try to open a link within an issue in new issue view, the link does not open in a new tab rather it will open in the same tab. Specifically observed in Windows OS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any issue -> In the description/Comment, add an URL. Eg : [www.google.com|http://www.google.com/] 
 # Press ctrl + mouse click (left click) 
 # You will see the link open in the same tab as of the Jira cloud site.

h3. Expected Results

When clicked, it should open in a new tab.
h3. Actual Results

Virtual keyboard is used to demonstrate, however this is the case with Physical Keyboard as well.

!clickbug.gif|width=286,height=118!
h3. Workaround

Right click on the link -> choose "Open link in new tab"
fields.summary: Ctrl+click on a link does not open the site in new tab - New issue view

fields.description: When Jira is integrated with a service like Azure DevOps or Github, and a commit is made, it is possible to catch the commit message in Automation using the smart value commit.message. The issue is that this message is truncated at 50 characters or on first line break. Since it is possible to indicate messages larger than 50 characters on the version control side, this request is to increase the character limit on Jira side.
fields.summary: Increase commit message character limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a team-managed project if the access is Open a user inside a role without any permission can execute most of the features (assign, edit, transition, etc).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed project;
 # In Project Settings > Access > Change Access, leave it Open;
 # On Manage Roles create a new role without any access permission;
 # Add a user to only this role

h3. Expected Results

The user wouldn't be able to use the features he doesn't have access to.
h3. Actual Results

The user will be able to edit, assign, transition and other functionalities.
h3. Workaround
Change the Access to Private that will respect the permissions defined in the role.
fields.summary: Users in a role without permissions can execute most features in team-managed project if the Access is Open

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When email notifications for changes in assignee are sent out in text formatting, the current and previous assignee are set to Unassigned

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set email notification format to text
 # Change issue assignee from one user to another
 # Check the email notification
 # Notice the current and previous assignee are set to Unassigned

h3. Expected Results
Assignee:<current_assignee> (was:<previous_assignee>)

h3. Actual Results
Assignee: Unassigned  (was: Unassigned)
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-05-13 11.41.57-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assignee is set to Unassigned in text formatted email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using workflow rules in team-managed project to update the labels field with certain values, it is supposed to append the field value with the existing value, however this does not happen. Whilst, the description states that it will add to existing values :

!image-2021-05-12-21-06-46-286.png|width=378,height=340!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed project
 # Go to project settings -> Issue types -> click on "Edit workflow"
 # In one of the transitions -> under rules -> click on + icon 
 # Choose update field value -> choose the field "Labels" 
 # Add the desired labels
 # Save and close the workflow. 
 # Create an issue -> add a label of your choice -> transition the issue to the destined status -> you will see that the label value is replaced with the one entered in the workflow rule.

h3. Expected Results

Values are appended to the existing values.
h3. Actual Results

!labels update.gif|width=457,height=197!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Updating "Labels" field via rules in team-managed project does not work

fields.description:
Create a comment on the *Old Issue View* as follows:

!image-2021-05-12-17-37-23-520.png|width=500,height=277!

On the *Old Issue View* it is displayed with the right format:

!image-2021-05-12-17-35-08-597.png|width=421,height=111!

On the *New Issue View* it is not displayed as it should be:

!image-2021-05-12-17-35-37-910.png|width=421,height=111!

Even the *New Issue View* doesn't display the *Nyan* code at all when creating a code snippet box:

!image-2021-05-12-17-40-58-144.png|width=501,height=208!
fields.summary: {code:nyan} not works on the New Issue View
